alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Madison; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:09AM CST until January 30 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Paint Rock River near Woodville affecting Marshall, Jackson and Madison Counties. For the PAINT ROCK RIVER...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Paint Rock River near Woodville. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flood waters affect mostly bottomland along the river...including low lying farm and pasturelands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 16.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 04/27/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM CST.
